value.title: Show Total in Stacked Bar and Column Chart in Power BI
value.excerpt: During this video, we will learn how we can show total value in a stacked bar chart and stacked column chart in Power BI. Earlier to show the total value in stacked bar chart and column chart we need to use some alternative approach. Now, with this new Power BI update, you can easily show Total by turn

value.title: Sort a table using Multiple Columns in Power BI | Multi Column Sort in Power  BI
value.excerpt: In this vLog, we will learn, how we can sort a tale using multiple columns for the table visualization in Power BI.  This feature has been rolled out in March 2020 Power BI Desktop Update.  Here, first we will learn how we can create apply a sort for the multiple column. Then we will change the sort

value.title: 3 ways Reporting Services and Power BI work together

From the Power BI mobile app, to pinning visualizations to a dashboard and how Reporting Services handles Power BI Desktop files.  #PowerBI #SSRS  SUBSCRIBE! https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCFp1vaKzpfvoGai0vE5VJ0w?sub_confirmation=1

value.title: 4 Troubleshooting connectivity tips with the gateway
value.excerpt: This video was based on a call I had last week relating to troubleshooting connectivity to a SQL Server named instance from the Power BI gateway. value.title: Are you backing up your Power BI Dataset???
value.excerpt: While Power BI is a SaaS service, backing up your dataset is still important. What if something was accidently deleted? How do you recover it? Patrick shows you how you can get a backup / restore process in place so you can sleep at night.  Backup/Restore PowerShell Script: https://guyinacu.be/backuprestorescript

value.title: Azure Active Directory and Power BI
value.excerpt: I take a look at how Power BI and Azure Active Directory interact.  Really it is more about Azure Active Directory and how do you get users into AAD.  This came up as I get pinged a lot from folks wondering how they can use AAD with Power BI, not necessarily realizing that it is already there.  http://blogs.technet.com/b/powerbisupport/archive/2015/09/15/azure-active-directory-and-power-bi.aspx

value.title: DAX! Uggg - Where do you start? | Power BI

Adam has some resources to get you started in your journey.  Beginning the journey:  MS Learn: User DAX in Power BI Desktop (Free) https://docs.microsoft.com/learn/paths/dax-power-bi/

value.title: Debugging a slow Power BI report with Phil Seamark
value.excerpt: Phil sits down with us to walk through his process in debugging a slow Power BI report. This uses some new features in Power BI Desktop as well as using DAX Studio to get further insights.  Connect with Phil Twitter: https://twitter.com/PhilSeamark Blog: https://dax.tips/   Guy in a Cube courses: https://guyinacu.be/courses

value.title: Demystifying Custom Partitions in Power BI
value.excerpt: We talk about Incremental Refresh a lot, but what if you need custom partitions in Power BI? How do you even create those? They look scary! Patrick takes the mystery away and walks you through how you can create them.  Partitions in tabular models https://docs.microsoft.com/analysis-services/tabular-models/partitions-ssas-tabular

value.title: Expand lists in Power BI (also a look at M Syntax)

value.title: Power BI parameters - Updating in the Power BI Service or with APIs
value.excerpt: In this video, Adam looks at how you can update Power BI parameters within the service or by using APIs. You can create Power BI Parameters within Power BI Desktop using Power Query. Then you can update those Power BI parameters once the report is published to the Power BI service.  PowerShell Samples:
